intro: Scleranthus perennis subsp. stroblii, commonly known as the European perennial sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the family Polygonaceae, characterized by its distinctive, triangular stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is often found in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. This subspecies is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
